meanings.definition: To restrain or prevent (someone or something) from acting or progressing.
meanings.sent1: Loud noises can be inhibiting for studying.
meanings.sent2: Fear can sometimes inhibit us from trying new things.
meanings.sent3: The shy turtle felt inhibiting when all eyes were on him.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog inhibiting our view of the beautiful sunrise.
meanings.sent5: The heavy chains of doubt were inhibiting her from reaching her goals.

meanings.definition: To hinder or limit the activity or development of (something).
meanings.sent1: The lack of resources is inhibiting the project's progress.
meanings.sent2: Bad weather can inhibit outdoor activities.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy was inhibiting the calm of the household.
meanings.sent4: The strict rules were inhibiting the creativity of the students.
meanings.sent5: The thick mud was inhibiting the movement of the car.

meanings.definition: Causing a feeling of self-consciousness or embarrassment.
meanings.sent1: Her inhibiting dress made her feel out of place at the party.
meanings.sent2: His inhibiting stutter made public speaking difficult for him.
meanings.sent3: The inhibiting silence in the room made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: The inhibiting spotlight made her cheeks flush with embarrassment.
meanings.sent5: The inhibiting outfit made her wish she had chosen something else to wear.
